summary: Dawne C. Miller was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978. These documents provide her name, and in some cases, her salary and gross pay during specific periods. The documents indicate she was employed by the SCAS from at least April 1978 to December 1978.
significance: Dawne C. Miller's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating she was involved in the investigation into the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of her role are not detailed in these documents.
